nodes.text: Gusha was a green-furred, red-eyed Lepi whose name translated from Huttese to Galactic Basic Standard as "Lucky." As the owner and bartender of the Gusha's Luck cantina in Tatooine's spaceport city of Mos Eisley, Gusha was on-duty in 137 ABY when the bounty hunter Cade Skywalker and his co-pilot Jariah Syn were seated at the bar. After Syn left, Gusha poured two glasses of Merenzane Gold for the Imperial agent Gunn Yage, into one of which she slipped a drug in order to knock Skywalker unconscious. Yage took her prey elsewhere, and when Syn returned shortly thereafter, Gusha told the co-pilot of the events that had transpired in his absence.

Gusha was created by John Ostrander and Jan Duursema for the comic book series Star Wars: Legacy, and appears briefly in the series' thirty-eighth issue. A glossary included in the issue's letters section indicates that the word Gusha translates to "Lucky" in Huttese, meaning that Gusha's cantina could be called "Lucky's Luck."
